intro: Leptactina prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate leptactina, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and typically have a pale green or white hue. Leptactina prostrata is adapted to thrive in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
